requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page Valentine website dedicated to “Ahana” with romantic English copy.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage renders without errors on desktop and mobile widths.
The name “Ahana” is prominently displayed in the hero section.
All visible text is in English.
Content and visuals clearly communicate a Valentine/romantic theme.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React app shell that renders the Ahana Valentine page (hero, letter, reasons, CTA) and ensures responsive layout with Tailwind utilities.

Implement the full single-page content with romantic English copy and responsive section structure (no additional routes). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) for consistent UI primitives; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure document metadata supports the single-page experience (title already set) and optionally add a romantic typography font import to match the Valentine theme.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent Valentine love-letter visual theme (non-blue/purple primary palette) across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is used across all sections (typography + color palette + spacing).
Primary styling is not based on blue/purple as the dominant palette.
UI remains readable with sufficient contrast for text on backgrounds.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn) and base typography for a Valentine palette (pinks/reds/creams), ensuring accessible contrast and consistent spacing/typography across the page.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the Valentine palette and any custom keyframes used by decorative animations, keeping styling consistent and avoiding blue/purple as primary.
Apply the theme consistently across all sections using Tailwind classes and shadcn-ui components for cohesive spacing/typography; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add four core sections (hero, love letter, reasons list, closing CTA) with a simple local interaction in the closing section.
acceptanceCriteria: All four sections are present and reachable by scrolling.
The “Reasons I love you” list displays at least 5 items.
The closing section includes a simple interaction (e.g., buttons or toggle) that updates the UI state locally in the browser.

file_operations.description: Add: (1) Hero banner with prominent “Ahana”, (2) short love note/letter section, (3) static “Reasons I love you” list (>= 5 items), and (4) closing CTA with local state interaction (e.g., Yes/No buttons updating on-page message). Use shadcn-ui Button/Card (or similar) for the CTA and content framing; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the single-page layout to render the AhanaValentinePage so all sections are reachable by scrolling (no additional routes).

requirements.summary: Add lightweight decorative animations (e.g., floating hearts) that respect prefers-reduced-motion and performance.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one decorative animation is visible on the page.
If the OS/browser prefers-reduced-motion setting is enabled, animations are reduced/disabled appropriately.
Animation does not significantly degrade scrolling or interaction responsiveness.

file_operations.description: Create a lightweight decorative animation layer (e.g., floating hearts/sparkles) implemented with performant CSS animations and minimal DOM, with behavior gated by prefers-reduced-motion.
Add keyframes/utility classes for decorative animations and include a prefers-reduced-motion override that disables/reduces motion for the FloatingHearts component.
Render the FloatingHearts decorative layer in a non-intrusive way (behind content, pointer-events disabled) to keep scrolling and CTA interaction responsive.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and display them on the page (no backend image delivery).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The homepage renders and displays the generated assets (e.g., hero background/illustration and a small decorative icon).
No backend endpoints are used for image delivery.

file_operations.description: Add the generated romantic heart-pattern background image asset at the required path for static serving.
Add the generated envelope-and-heart illustration image asset at the required path for static serving.
Add the generated small heart icon image asset at the required path for static serving.

Reference and render the static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated: use frontend/public/assets/generated/ahana-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as a hero/section background, frontend/public/assets/generated/ahana-hero-illustration.dim_1200x800.png as the hero illustration, and frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-icon.dim_128x128.png as a decorative icon in the UI.
